p: As observed for corn oil, thin stillage contained β-sitosterol as the prevalent sterol (88.3–170 mg kg −1 on a wet mass basis), followed by sitostanol (47.4–86.6 mg kg −1), campesterol + stigmasterol (29.5–54.0 mg kg −1), a sterol tentatively identified as δ-5-avenasterol (18.0–61.3 mg kg −1) and trace amounts of ergosterol (4.87–11.3 mg kg −1). The percent distribution of single sterols in post-fermentation corn oil and thin stillage were similar as can be seen in Figure S1. In absolute terms, the sterol content of thin tillage is very low on a wet mass basis (205–322 mg kg −1 wet mass) compared to corn oil (15832–17912 mg kg −1). Squalene, at levels comprised between 10.1 and 19.2 mg kg −1 wet mass, was also detected in thin stillage.
